comment.author: 87914514@N00
comment._content: I agree- the label is the best bit! -- Seen next to a fellow photo of Flickr Commons. (?)

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: Crazy good, right?  When we started getting corrections to our captions via Flickr peeps (thanks!) we had to discuss internally how to parse all that new information into the records - keeping the original caption per these old labels and then supplementing with new information in our records.  A pretty interesting conversation as a result of our participation in The Commons.

comment.author: 87914514@N00
comment._content:
I can imagine.

The red sticker label reminds me of a jam jar label.  
Like in an other reality it might have said 'Apricot jam, last summer' or something equally prosaic.

comment.author: 27906564@N07
comment._content: The way the vintage color photograph and hand written label are layered also with a type written label the viewer can't  entirely read gives the archive material the look of a fabricated art collage -  I think that makes it appealing to a broader audience.

comment.author: 39312862@N00
comment._content: OMG, shots of the entire slide, including side labels, are just as fabulous as the image on the slide.

comment.author: 41361030@N00
comment._content:
Which Needle is this? The one currently in Central Park, along the Thames Embankment, in Paris, or the one still in Egypt?

It's always neat to see things in a historical condition or location that is no longer the case.

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content:
Hi Travis,

We just heard back from curatorial on this (thanks Kathy, thanks Ann!) - 

The term "Cleopatra's Needle" is applied to all obelisks, but this particular  "Cleopatra's Needle" is now located in Central Park.

Shelley

comment.author: 41361030@N00
comment._content: Very neat. Thanks Kathy & Ann, for taking time out of your busy day to satisfy my curiosity!!
